measured_by: colored-circle choice task with variable time delays (Bear & Bloom, 2016 paradigm)
justification: "The dependent variable was whether or not participants had chosen the red circle… if the coefficient is significantly greater than 0, it will suggest that the likelihood of choosing the red circle decreases as the time delay gets longer (i.e., a postdictive effect was observed)." This task—reporting whether one had selected the red circle after different delays—operationalises the postdictive effect of choice.

measured_by: classical spatial cueing paradigm with rectangle-bar cues (Posner cue)
justification: "Experiment 2 employed … the classic spatial cueing paradigm (Posner, 1980)… As the two white circles changed colors, a spatial cue was simultaneously presented… The cue… was termed a valid or invalid condition." The spatial cueing setup is used to manipulate and thus measure participants’ allocation of visual attention.
